item.title: Thank You to the Thomas & Agnes Carvel Foundation for Investing in Our Students
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
At Destination: College, we believe that access to higher education is built through relationships, guidance, and sustained support. That belief is strengthened when partners step forward to invest in our students and their futures. We are deeply grateful to the Thomas & Agnes Carvel Foundation for awarding Destination: College a $15,000 grant to support our…

The post Thank You to the Thomas & Agnes Carvel Foundation for Investing in Our Students appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
At Destination: College, we believe that access to higher education is built through relationships, guidance, and sustained support. That belief is strengthened when partners step forward to invest in our students and their futures.

We are deeply grateful to the Thomas & Agnes Carvel Foundation for awarding Destination: College a $15,000 grant to support our work with student-athletes as they navigate the college journey.

This generous investment helps power the personalized guidance our students rely on — from navigating the college application process to understanding financial aid, staying on track through senior year, and continuing support once they enroll in college. For our students, this support can be the difference between uncertainty and confidence, between starting college and staying the course.

The Carvel Foundation’s commitment reflects a shared belief in educational opportunity and long-term impact. Their support strengthens our ability to show up consistently for students and families, meet them where they are, and walk alongside them through one of the most important transitions of their lives.

As we close out the year, we are reminded that this work is only possible because of partners who believe in our mission — and a community of supporters who make it sustainable.

If you’re inspired by the Carvel Foundation’s generosity, we invite you to join them. A gift to our Year-End Campaign helps ensure Destination: College can continue supporting students this year and beyond.

Together, we can keep doors open — and help students walk confidently through them.

Donate to the Year-End Campaign

The post Thank You to the Thomas & Agnes Carvel Foundation for Investing in Our Students appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: ✨A Major Milestone: DC Seniors Complete the FAFSA—And They Crushed It
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
More than 60 Destination: College senior student-athletes recently took one of the most important steps on their path toward college: completing the FAFSA. It’s a detailed, high-stakes financial aid application that can feel overwhelming, especially for students navigating the process for the first time. But with the encouragement of their families, the guidance of our…

The post ✨A Major Milestone: DC Seniors Complete the FAFSA—And They Crushed It appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
More than 60 Destination: College senior student-athletes recently took one of the most important steps on their path toward college: completing the FAFSA.

It’s a detailed, high-stakes financial aid application that can feel overwhelming, especially for students navigating the process for the first time. But with the encouragement of their families, the guidance of our volunteers, and the steady support of their coaches and school, our seniors showed up ready—and they absolutely crushed it.

We couldn’t be prouder of their hard work and determination.

Moments like these don’t happen by accident. They are the result of community: DC coaches who encourage their players, volunteers who sit beside students with patience and confidence, and families who show unwavering support. Together, they help our students take a step that can change the trajectory of their futures.

As we near the end of the year, we’re inviting you to be part of this momentum.

Zion Watkins – Boys Basketball, Class of ’26 Naari Davis – Girls Basketball, Class of ’26 Bernard Laurent – Football, Class of ’26

Your donation to our Year-End Campaign directly fuels programs that guide students through FAFSA completion, college applications, decision-making, and the transition into college life.

If you believe every student deserves access to higher education—and the support to get there—we hope you’ll make a gift today.

Contribute to Our
Year-End Campaign Now

Congratulations to our incredible seniors for reaching this milestone.

Go Knights!

Cortellia Gilling – Class of ’26 BJ Robinson – Boys Basketball, Class of ’26 Adrian Sookai – Baseball, Class of ’26

The post ✨A Major Milestone: DC Seniors Complete the FAFSA—And They Crushed It appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: Celebrating Student Success & Investing in the Next 20 Years at Destination: College
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
As we close out 2025, we’re celebrating the remarkable achievements of our student-athletes — and the community that helps make every milestone possible. Take Joel Okine, who joined Destination: College as a high school student with big dreams and a drive to achieve them. With support from his mentors, Joel went on to earn an…

The post Celebrating Student Success & Investing in the Next 20 Years at Destination: College appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
As we close out 2025, we’re celebrating the remarkable achievements of our student-athletes — and the community that helps make every milestone possible.

Take Joel Okine, who joined Destination: College as a high school student with big dreams and a drive to achieve them. With support from his mentors, Joel went on to earn an honors degree from Buffalo State College. Today, he’s paying that support forward as a mentor to younger DC student-athletes who are pursuing their own goals.

Or Teneisia Brown, who first came to DC as a 10th grader. After excelling as a Division I athlete and graduating from Fairleigh Dickinson University, she is now pursuing her Master’s in Higher Education while leading the Providence College Women’s Basketball team — carrying forward the encouragement she once received.

Stories like these reflect the strength of our full continuum of programs.
Through Team Reads, we offer high-school athletes in the Mount Vernon City School District academic support and a positive, team-centered environment that keeps them engaged in school. Our Mentoring Program connects students with both caring adult mentors and peer mentors, helping them navigate academics, sports, and the transition to college with confidence. And in the Cooney College Center, students receive one-on-one support with college applications, financial aid, and campus visits — ensuring they’re prepared for every step ahead.

As we approach our 20th anniversary in 2026, we’re not only reflecting on how far we’ve come — we’re building momentum for the next decade of student success. Your generosity makes that future possible. A year-end gift to Destination: College ensures that more students have the resources, relationships, and opportunities they need to succeed in college and beyond.

Join us in investing in our students’ futures. Your support today opens doors for years to come.

Donate Now

Follow us, like us, tag us on Facebook and Instagram. Share the link. Email the link

  • Facebook
  • Instagram

The post Celebrating Student Success & Investing in the Next 20 Years at Destination: College appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: ✨Introducing Alumni Updates✨
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
At Destination: College we love staying in touch and giving support to our alumni as they progress through college and beyond. Today we proudly launch a new and ongoing feature called Alumni Updates, highlighting the stories of Destination: College alumni now in College. For our first story, we proudly introduce you to Heily Gonzalez, who…

The post ✨Introducing Alumni Updates✨ appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
At Destination: College we love staying in touch and giving support to our alumni as they progress through college and beyond. Today we proudly launch a new and ongoing feature called Alumni Updates, highlighting the stories of Destination: College alumni now in College. For our first story, we proudly introduce you to Heily Gonzalez, who will be graduating from Cornell University in 2026. Heily stays in touch with Destination: College Board Member, volunteer and mentor Tracy McVey. Thank you to Tracy for initiating and facilitating this piece. We’ll let Heily tell you what she’s up to in her own words…read on!

“I am currently a senior at Cornell triple majoring in Government, Sociology, and American Studies with a minor in Law & Society. 

This year has been a culmination of everything I’ve worked toward. 

I’ve taken upper-level courses that deepen my interest in immigration, inequality, and public-interest law, and I’ve maintained strong academic standing while balancing several leadership and community roles on campus. 

I recently completed my term as President of the Dominican Students Association, and this is my fourth year in Cornell’s Black Ivy Pre-Law Society, where I serve as the Vice President of Academics. 

I am also a member of the Sabor Latino Dance Ensemble, which has allowed me to stay connected to my culture while performing across campus. 

Beyond campus involvement, I interned at Proskauer Rose LLP over the past two summers and gained hands-on legal experience through the Cornell Public Defender Program and Cornell Law School’s Asylum & CAT Appellate Clinic. 

These academic, leadership, and legal experiences have shaped my direction and strengthened my preparation for law school.

Short term, I am applying to law school with the goal of enrolling in Fall 2026. I hope to continue building on my legal experiences through internships, mentorship, and community work. 

Long term, I plan to pursue a career in public-interest and immigration law, focusing on expanding access to justice for immigrant and first-generation communities.

I also plan to continue growing INSPIRE, the nonprofit that Maame Forson (Harvard ’25) and I co-founded to advance opportunities for first-generation high school students.”

We at Destination: College are all incredibly proud of Heily and her accomplishments thus far and are excited to follow and share in her journey.

Stay tuned for more Alumni Updates coming soon!

Be the first to know…subscribe below and we’ll deliver right to your inbox.

Subscribe now Destination: College alum Heily Gonzalez atends Cornell University

The post ✨Introducing Alumni Updates✨ appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: Destination: College Student-Athletes Explore Manhattanville College, Mercy, and Pace University
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
Destination: College student-athletes visited Manhattanville, Mercy, and Pace University to explore campus life and prepare for their college journeys.

The post Destination: College Student-Athletes Explore Manhattanville College, Mercy, and Pace University appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
Recently, over three exciting days, our Destination: College student-athletes took part in a series of college campus tours, visiting Manhattanville College, Mercy University, and Pace University — all guided by our Director of College Programs, Saskya Molina and Destination: College volunteers.

These visits are more than just tours — they’re a key part of our college readiness program, helping students imagine themselves on campus, connect their academic and athletic goals, and experience firsthand what college life can look like.

During the tours, students met with admissions counselors, explored classrooms, residence halls, and facilities, and even connected with DC alumni currently studying at Pace and Mercy. Hearing their stories and advice added an inspiring personal touch — showing our student-athletes that with dedication and support, their own college dreams are within reach.

At Destination: College, we believe that exposure is empowerment. Experiences like these help our students set goals, stay motivated, and understand the steps needed to succeed in higher education and beyond.

A heartfelt thank-you to Manhattanville College, Mercy University, and Pace University for welcoming our students — and to our incredible alumni for sharing their time and wisdom!

Learn more about how Destination: College helps student-athletes prepare for success in college and beyond at www.destinationcollegeny.org.

item.title: Honoring Our MVHS Coaches on National Coaches Day
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
At Destination: College, we know that success—both in the classroom and on the field—takes teamwork. On National Coaches Day, we proudly celebrate the incredible Mount Vernon High School coaches who dedicate their time, energy, and hearts to shaping the next generation of student-athletes. Our coaches do more than build strong teams—they build strong futures. Every…

The post Honoring Our MVHS Coaches on National Coaches Day appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
At Destination: College, we know that success—both in the classroom and on the field—takes teamwork. On National Coaches Day, we proudly celebrate the incredible Mount Vernon High School coaches who dedicate their time, energy, and hearts to shaping the next generation of student-athletes.

Our coaches do more than build strong teams—they build strong futures. Every day, they mentor, motivate, and model the values that help students reach their full potential. Whether it’s showing up early for practice, offering encouragement after a tough game, or helping a student balance school and sports, their impact reaches far beyond the scoreboard.

Destination: College is honored to partner with MVHS coaches who share our mission: ensuring every student-athlete is prepared to succeed in college and in life. Their dedication helps our students develop the confidence, discipline, and leadership skills that open doors to higher education and lifelong success.

To all the MVHS coaches who give so much of themselves—thank you. Your commitment inspires us, your students, and our entire community. Today and every day, we celebrate you.

Boys Basketball: Bob Cimmino (V) / Bryan Browne (JV)
Girls Basketball: Erica Naughton (V) / David Clarke (JV)
Baseball: Ernie Richardson (V)
Cheerleading: Mekiyah Knox (V) / Makayla McIntire (JV)
Football: Mark “Sparx” Murray (V)
Girls Flag Football: Mark “Sparx” Murray (V)
Boys Soccer: Ripton Cooke (V) / Samori Pennant (JV)
Girls Soccer: Jay Concepcion (V)
Softball: Craig Ramsey (V)
Boys Swimming: Patrick Flores
Girls Swimming: Anne Murray
Boys Track & Field: Akil berry
Girls Track & Field: Charlie Winslow
Boys Volleyball: Taevon Allen
Girls Volleyball: Tashi Campbell-Tulloch (V) / Dorothy Rota (JV)
Wrestling: Jay Concepcion (V)

Get Involved
At Destination: College, we’re always looking for volunteers, mentors, and supporters who believe in the power of education and sports. Learn more about how you can help us continue this important work:
Volunteer with DC
Make a Donation

Coach Knox and MVHS Cheerleading Left: Coach Naughton. Center: Coach Cimmino Coach Cooke Third from right: Dorothy Rota Coach Murray and Coach Berry Coach Flores and Coach Murphy Coach Cimmino




The post Honoring Our MVHS Coaches on National Coaches Day appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: Volunteer Breakfast: Celebrating the Heart of Destination: College
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
Last week, Destination: College hosted our dedicated volunteers for our annual Volunteer Breakfast at the Bronxville Field Club. The event was a chance to reconnect with the people who make our mission possible and to highlight the impact of volunteering. Highlights from the Breakfast It was a joyful reminder that together, we are building a…

The post Volunteer Breakfast: Celebrating the Heart of Destination: College appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
Last week, Destination: College hosted our dedicated volunteers for our annual Volunteer Breakfast at the Bronxville Field Club. The event was a chance to reconnect with the people who make our mission possible and to highlight the impact of volunteering.

Highlights from the Breakfast

  • A presentation by our Executive Director, Michele Roque discussing our mission, our programs, our goals and our successes.
  • Stories of student success reminded us of the power of consistency and encouragement.
  • Volunteers connected with one another sharing experiences and ideas.
  • Our team expressed gratitude and shared exciting goals for the year ahead.

It was a joyful reminder that together, we are building a stronger foundation for the next generation of college-bound student athletes.

Honoring Our Volunteers

To every volunteer who gives their time to Destination: College: thank you.

Your efforts — whether in Team Reads, tutoring, in the Cooney College Center, or supporting our student-athletes in countless other ways — are changing lives.

The Benefits of Volunteering

Volunteering at Destination: College is about more than putting in hours — it’s about transformation:

  • For Our Student Athletes: Volunteers provide encouragement, academic guidance, and confidence-building support. That belief in a student’s potential often makes all the difference.
  • For Our Volunteers: Many tell us they gain as much as they give — through meaningful relationships, personal growth, and the joy of seeing students succeed.
  • For Our Community: Volunteers strengthen the entire Destination: College family by fostering connection, collaboration, and shared purpose.

Join Us

The work of Destination: College is only possible because of our volunteers. Whether you’re interested in tutoring, mentoring, or supporting our programs in other ways, we’d love for you to get involved.

Learn more about volunteering

Contact Michele Roque mroque@destinationcollegeny.org

Together, we can help every student see — and achieve — their full potential.

The post Volunteer Breakfast: Celebrating the Heart of Destination: College appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: Back to School: A New Season of Growth for Destination: College Student-Athletes
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
As summer winds down and the new school year begins, our Destination: College (DC) student-athletes are stepping back onto the fields, courts, and classrooms with fresh energy and determination. This time of year is always filled with excitement and possibility—new classes, new teammates, and new goals to chase both academically and athletically. At DC, we…

The post Back to School: A New Season of Growth for Destination: College Student-Athletes appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
As summer winds down and the new school year begins, our Destination: College (DC) student-athletes are stepping back onto the fields, courts, and classrooms with fresh energy and determination. This time of year is always filled with excitement and possibility—new classes, new teammates, and new goals to chase both academically and athletically.

At DC, we know that balancing the demands of being a student-athlete takes discipline, resilience, and heart. Our students carry more than just the weight of textbooks and practice schedules; they also carry the dreams of attending college, to succeed at the highest level, and to inspire others who will follow in their footsteps.

This fall, we’re proud to watch as our 2025 Cooney Scholars begin their college careers and all of our DC student athletes who worked hard over the summer—whether through training, internships, or summer courses. Their commitment shows us that the values we emphasize—dedication, perseverance, and community—extend far beyond the game.

As the year ahead unfolds, DC will continue to provide the guidance, mentorship, and support our students need to succeed and persist. From SAT prep to college tours, from financial aid applications to tutoring and mentoring opportunities, we’re committed to ensuring that every student-athlete has the tools to succeed in the classroom.

We look forward to cheering on our athletes this season and celebrating their victories—big and small—along the way. Whether it’s earning a personal best, submitting a strong college application, or simply showing up with courage and grit, every step forward matters.

How You Can Help

Destination: College’s mission is only possible because of the generosity and support of our community. If you’re inspired by the dedication of our student-athletes, there are several meaningful ways you can get involved:

  • Volunteer Your Time – Become a mentor, help at events, or share your expertise through workshops. Every hour of encouragement makes a difference. Sign Up to Volunteer
  • Make a Donation – Your financial support ensures our students have access to tutoring, college prep, scholarships, and resources they need to thrive. Donate Today
  • Offer an Internship or Career Opportunity – Opening doors for our students to gain real-world experience is one of the most impactful ways to invest in their future. Provide an Internship – Please email Michele Roque mroque@destinationcollegeny.org

Together, we can provide the foundation our students need to succeed in college, in athletics, and in life.

Destination: College is more than a program—it’s a team, a family, and a launchpad for dreams.

The post Back to School: A New Season of Growth for Destination: College Student-Athletes appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: Getting Ready for College!
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
Our 2025 graduates, now rising freshmen, are eagerly preparing to begin new adventures at their new colleges in the coming weeks. Each summer we attend a wonderful event to shop for free dorm supplies hosted by Grad Bag. Grad Bag is a non-profit founded in 2012. They have provided dorm room essentials for more than…

The post Getting Ready for College! appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
Our 2025 graduates, now rising freshmen, are eagerly preparing to begin new adventures at their new colleges in the coming weeks. Each summer we attend a wonderful event to shop for free dorm supplies hosted by Grad Bag.

Grad Bag is a non-profit founded in 2012. They have provided dorm room essentials for more than 5,500 students and diverted nearly 170 tons of materials from the waste stream. Grad Bag visits college campuses to collect up donations of dorm supplies which are then distributed to students up and down the East Coast.

IT’s a great day for DC student athletes to shop among the stacks of comforters, pillows, sheets, shower caddies, mirrors, lamps and much more. We bring our student athletes by bus our volunteers meet us at the event to help transport all of the dorm merchandise back to Mount Vernon. There’s way too much stuff to fit on the bus!

Everyone is included. Students unable to to attend are invited to have family of a friend shop in their stead.

The photos tell the story! Below are photos of our group of very happy students, who just took one step closing to going to college!

The post Getting Ready for College! appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: New Additions! Alumnae Update: Summer of 2025 – Edit
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
We love maintaining connections with our Destination: College alum and it’s especially exciting when they share their ongoing adventures with us. Here’s how some of them are spending their summer this year! Thank you to all for sending the great photos! Keep up the great work and we hope you enjoy your summer!

The post New Additions! Alumnae Update: Summer of 2025 – Edit appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
We love maintaining connections with our Destination: College alum and it’s especially exciting when they share their ongoing adventures with us. Here’s how some of them are spending their summer this year!

Zoe (Cooney Scholar ’23) Just finished her final presentation at her internship! Zoe is working a remote product management internship at a tech company and in the meantime attending conferences to build her network! She joined SEO and attended their conference in the city. Zoe also attended the Girls Who Lead: Women In Media Panel, as well as attended the FutureNow Media and Entertainment Conference. Isabella (Cooney Scholar ’23) is a rising junior at Hobart and William Smith and has a summer internship at The Black Project! Ellie (Cooney Scholar ’25) is a rising freshman at RIT and is completing her pre-college forms. Left to right – Najae (Class of ’24), Sarah (Class of ’24), Amanda (Class of ’22), Brittany (Class of ’22) are working together at the NewYork-Presbyterian Youth Market Internship Charlotte (Cooney Scholar ’24) is visiting her family – both human and furry – in Portugal Tianna (Cooney Scholar ’25) Second from left – is spending her summer practicing basketball with her team, the Panthers at SUNY Purchase Ziah (Class of ’24) is a rising sophomore and bio major at LaSalle University. She is spending time with family in Jamaica this summer. Domingos (DC Cooney Scholar ’24) – Is an EOP student at SUNY Cortland and is working as an EOP Counselor for incoming freshmen Masi (DC Cooney Scholar ’24) is a rising sophomore at UPenn and is working this summer at the Mount Vernon City Clerk’s Office Innocence (DC Class of ’23) – Will be exploring a concentration in medical studies this summer Alexander (DC Cooney Scholar ’24) – Sophomore at Manhattanville University and this summer will be catching up with friends and playing soccer Viviana (DC Cooney Scholar ’23) – A UPenn rising junior and working on research in a UPenn lab Kamora and Kimora (DC Cooney Scholars ’25) – Both attending and succeeding in the EOP program at Stony Brook University Kendarlin (DC Cooney Scholar ’25) – is enjoying the EOP program at SUNY Brockport Sai (DC Class of ’25) – is in the EOP program at University at Albany Sade (DC Class of ’23) – A rising junior at UConn and this summer is participating in 2 medical internships; One in Peru and one in Ghana Jevaugh (DC Class of ’23) – Is a rising junior at UMass at Dartmouth majoring in mechanical engineering and is spending his summer playing rugby Pariz (Cooney Scholar ’24) – A rising sophomore at Siena College and this summer is working as a Camper Care counselor helping campers with emotional and behavioral challenges Ain (DC Class of ’23) – A rising junior at City College NY is spending her summer exploring NYC and doing photography Isis (DC Class of ’24) – A rising sophomore at University at Albany and working this summer as a camp counselor Tatiana (DC Cooney Scholar ’24) – Is a rising sophomore at Fordham University and is working this summer at an academy of childhood development Karran (D Cooney Scholar ’24) – Majoring in Electrical Engineering, named Rookie of the Year for Track & Field, featured in the MVP highlight video for the athletic department, finished the year strong with a 3.3 GPA and is part of the Optical Engineering Club too. Karran is very busy – well done! Abraham (DC Cooney Scholar ’25) – Abraham is doing well at Mercy University’s HEOP program Amanda (DC Class of ’24) – Just finished her semester abroad and is working this summer at the Department of Social Services Naveah (DC class of ’25 and Carissa (DC class of ’25) are attending summer orientation at SUNY Purchase. You got this girls! Eric (DC Class of ’23) – A rising junior at SUNY Morrisville, on the Dean’s List and President’s List. This summer Eric is working as a camp counselor at Y-COP of Mount Vernon Merissa (Top row, left; DC Cooney Scholar ’24) – A rising sophomore at University of Buffalo and spending her summer volunteering in a program for kids under five and their parents. The program provides parents a space to engage with and prep their kids for school.

Thank you to all for sending the great photos! Keep up the great work and we hope you enjoy your summer!

The post New Additions! Alumnae Update: Summer of 2025 – Edit appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: Introducing Our 2025 Cooney Scholars
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
Each year, Destination: College selects student-athletes from the graduating class to be honored as Cooney Scholars—students whose academic excellence, leadership, and grit, embody the very best of our mission. The Cooney Scholarship Program at Destination: College is named in memory of Jeff Cooney, DC’s former board member who was unwavering in his dedication to our…

The post Introducing Our 2025 Cooney Scholars appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
Each year, Destination: College selects student-athletes from the graduating class to be honored as Cooney Scholars—students whose academic excellence, leadership, and grit, embody the very best of our mission.

The Cooney Scholarship Program at Destination: College is named in memory of Jeff Cooney, DC’s former board member who was unwavering in his dedication to our mission. Following Mr. Cooney’s untimely passing in 2018, all DC scholarships were named in his honor, ensuring that his legacy lives on through the achievements of our students.

At our 2025 Best Night of the Year celebration—joined by members of the Cooney family—Destination: College honored the vital contributions of our coaches, volunteers, and supporters while proudly introducing this year’s class of Cooney Scholars.

The 2025 Cooney Scholars are 21 student-athletes who represent 12 different sports teams from all three Mount Vernon high schools: Mount Vernon High School, the Denzel Washington School of the Arts, and the STEAM Academy.

More than just a scholarship, the Cooney Program is a promise—to champion student-athletes with big dreams, and to support each Scholar for continued success through their college years and beyond.

Congratulations to our 2025 Cooney Scholars! We are so proud of you!

Kamora Alston, Girls Basketball Team Manager – Stony Brook University Brian Alvares, Boys Soccer – Pace University Isaac Amouzou, Boys Soccer / Boys Track, Macauley Honors Program at John Jay College Ellie De Grandpre, Girls Swimming / Basketball Team Manager – Rochester Institute of Technology Alana Delgado, Girls Soccer – Westchester Community College Alaa Ferea, Girls Tennis – Hostos Community College Ryan Freckleton, Boys Swimming – John Jay College Kendarlin Galvan, Girls Swimming / Girls Softball – SUNY Brockport McKale Green, Boys Track – Stony Brook University Abraham Hibbert, Boys Track – Mercy University Yahira Hospedales, Girls Basketball / Girls Flag Football – University at Albany Ivan Irogoyen-Rojas, Boys Soccer / Boys Track – Vassar College Flavia Lukaj, Girls Softball – City College of New York Kimora Morrison, Girls Track – Stony Brook University Tianna Patten, Girls Basketball / Girls Flag Football – SUNY Purchase Siena Regman, Girls Track – Stony Brook University William Robinson, Basketball – Hudson Valley Community College Thokozani Sambakunsi, Boys Soccer / Boys Track – Pace University Nango Seck, Football – SUNY Oneonta Jaden Smith, Boys Swimming – Pace University Tavien Tyler, Basketball – Monroe University

The post Introducing Our 2025 Cooney Scholars appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: Best Night of The Year 2025
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
By Board Chair Nancy McKenna On a gorgeous June evening before a sellout crowd, Destination: College (DC) celebrated this year’s class of Cooney Scholars with a very special guest- legendary NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell. Siwanoy Country Club proved a fitting venue to recognize the many who have made DC ‘s mission possible for over 19 years.…

The post Best Night of The Year 2025 appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
By Board Chair Nancy McKenna

On a gorgeous June evening before a sellout crowd, Destination: College (DC) celebrated this year’s class of Cooney Scholars with a very special guest- legendary NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell. Siwanoy Country Club proved a fitting venue to recognize the many who have made DC ‘s mission possible for over 19 years.

NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell with the Class of 2025 Cooney Scholars

A longtime resident of Bronxville, the Commissioner played football at Bronxville High School with Jeff Cooney, DC’s beloved former board member. Following Mr. Cooney’s untimely death in 2018, all DC scholarships were subsequently named in his honor.

Joined by members of the Cooney Family, DC celebrated the contributions of its many coaches, volunteers and generous supporters while acknowledging this year’s class of Cooney Scholars. They are 21 strong and members of 12 sports teams from all three of the high schools in Mount Vernon (Mount Vernon High School, STEAM Academy and the Denzel Washington School of the Arts). These individuals were selected based on academics, leadership, and grit.

The complete list of DC College Acceptances for 2025 L-R: Commissioner Goodell, Cynthia Cooney, Chris Cooney, Jane Goodell and George Cooney

The highlight of the evening was an interview with Commissioner Goodell by DC students, including five former, current and hopeful Cooney Scholars. The session was moderated by Mary Civiello, an Emmy Award winning journalist who is a longtime DC volunteer and supporter and who currently works as a communications coach for senior executives around the world.

L-R moderator Mary Civiello with the Commissioner and panelists. DC Cooney Scholar panelists with the Commissioner.

Questions posed by the students ranged from how the NFL works with players to enhance financial literacy, to the impact of coming from a political family on the Commissioner’s leadership style, to what advice he had for students trying to emulate that style and his success.

Commissioner Goodell accepting a DC shirt from panelist Elijah Morris, who along with fellow DC alum Jaden Fearon, designed and produced the shirt.

Every year, fueled by some 70 volunteers, DC works with 300 students both in high school and college. Academic assistance, mentoring and help with all aspects of college admissions, including financial aid, are key components of DC’s program. DC’s mission is to help students gain entry to the college best suited to their academic, financial and athletic needs. Board Chair Nancy McKenna expressed gratitude for the support of all in the room for helping DC achieve that mission and its goals. 

If you would like to join the DC family as a volunteer,  please reach out to Executive Director Michele Roque at mroque@destinationcollegeny.org to be part of the fall programs !

The post Best Night of The Year 2025 appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: College Knowledge for Our Graduating Seniors
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
College Knowledge comprises two sessions of informal discussion for Destination: College graduating seniors and is part of our College Readiness program. The sessions takes place in the Cooney College Center each May. The goals of College Knowledge are to give real-world information about starting college; provide support and reassurance in a safe, nurturing environment; tackle…

The post College Knowledge for Our Graduating Seniors appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
College Knowledge comprises two sessions of informal discussion for Destination: College graduating seniors and is part of our College Readiness program. The sessions takes place in the Cooney College Center each May. The goals of College Knowledge are to give real-world information about starting college; provide support and reassurance in a safe, nurturing environment; tackle impending challenges and changes that students may encounter; and provide relatable tools and skills for seniors to draw on.

This year the first session of College Knowledge was presented by Ms. Laura, our Director of College Success.

This session was focused on the concerns that the seniors may be having about going to college. For some this is about being away from home for the first time, for others it’s about making new friends, or getting used to being in a new and different environment, and for others it’s about doing well in their classes.

To break the ice, students were each given a balloon and a note card. On the notecard they anonymously write any fear or concern they have about going to college. They then placed the note into the ballon and inflated the balloon. Then the fun began as the balloons were tossed around College Center and finally randomly distributed amongst the students. Each student took it in turn to pop a balloon and read out loud the note inside. And then the students gave each other advice! The group was very insightful and articulate. Each student-athlete encouraged the other to stay true to who they are and to go for their goals no matter what.

Ms. Michele welcomed the student-athletes and turned the session over to Ms. Laura Ms. Laura with seniors College Knowledge for the Class of 2025


The second session of College Knowledge was all about perspective. This session was led by Ms. Laura and featured four Destination: College alums who have recently completed their freshman year at college. They shared their perspectives and experiences from their first year. Our graduating seniors listened intently. The alums talked about topics such as the importance of scheduling, writing tasks down, using google calendar and planning study groups ahead of time. They also talked about meeting new people and making friends, and how they had to step out of their comfort zone at times to do this.

DC seniors listen intently as DC alums talk about their experiences in their first year of college

The alums gave important advice such as “Don’t skip class” and “Communicating with professors is important.” They showed the seniors how to prioritize: Get work done before going out! And they reassured the seniors: College is hard and fun, but doable.

DC senior student-athlete Kai DC Alum Pariz DC senior student-athletes Tavien and William

The final College Knowledge message to this year’s seniors was “Don’t forget DC is here for you!”.
Over the coming weeks our Cooney Scholarship winners will be assigned a mentor who will guide and support them through their college years. DC provides regular online meetings and seminars for our graduates to attend while away at college. Destination: College’s College Success program begins with our graduating seniors and carries through with our DC Alumni. Our retention rates speak for themselves. https://destinationcollegeny.org/our-impact/ We are very excited to continue to work with the Class of 2025 as they begin their new chapters. Stay tuned!

DC senior student-athletes feeling good! DC senior student-athletes clapping for DC alums at the second session of College Knowledge 2025 DC Alum G’Yaah Ms. Laura leads a discussion with seniors attending College Knowledge 2025 The DC team and DC alums.
From left to right: Ms. Laura, Masi – UPenn, G’yaah – University at Albany, Ms. Michele, Elena – City College of New York, Pariz – Siena College, Ms. Linda.

The post College Knowledge for Our Graduating Seniors appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: Empowering Futures
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
The Impact of the Cooney College Center and Cooney Scholarship Program at Destination: College At the heart of every transformative educational journey is a support system that believes in the potential of students. At Destination: College, the Cooney College Center and the Cooney Scholarship Program stand as powerful testaments to what is possible when young…

The post Empowering Futures appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
The Impact of the Cooney College Center and Cooney Scholarship Program at Destination: College

At the heart of every transformative educational journey is a support system that believes in the potential of students. At Destination: College, the Cooney College Center and the Cooney Scholarship Program stand as powerful testaments to what is possible when young people are equipped with opportunity, mentorship, and financial support.

A Hub for College Dreams: The Cooney College Center

The Cooney College Center is more than just a physical space—it’s a beacon of hope and a launchpad for student success. Designed as a safe, welcoming environment, the Center provides critical college access resources for high school students. It offers academic support, personalized college counseling, application assistance, and workshops that demystify the entire college process.

What sets the Cooney College Center apart is its commitment to personalized attention. Students aren’t treated as numbers—they’re seen as individuals with unique goals, challenges, and dreams. The staff and volunteers walk side-by-side with students through every step of their college journey, fostering both capacity and confidence.

Investing in Potential: The Cooney Scholarship Program

While academic support is vital, financial barriers remain one of the most significant obstacles to college access and college success. The Cooney Scholarship Program directly addresses these challenges by providing funding to deserving students who have demonstrated perseverance, promise, and a commitment to higher education.

This scholarship isn’t just a financial boost—it’s a powerful vote of confidence. For some recipients, the Cooney Scholarship is the bridge between ambition and achievement. It empowers students to thrive in their first year of college, knowing that they have a community encouraging and advocating their success.

A Ripple Effect of Opportunity

Together, the Cooney College Center and the Cooney Scholarship Program exemplify the mission of Destination: College—to ensure that every student, regardless of background or income, has the tools and support to pursue higher education. These initiatives don’t just change individual lives; they uplift families, strengthen communities, and build a more equitable future.

As we look toward a world that increasingly values education, innovation, and resilience, the work being done at Destination: College is not only timely—it’s essential.

2025 Cooney Scholars

Our 2025 Cooney Scholars will be announced at The Best Night of the Year celebration on June 11, from 6:00PM to 8:00PM at the Siwanoy Country Club. The event honors the achievements of our student-athletes, dedicated coaches, passionate volunteers, and the exceptional 2025 Cooney Scholars.

This year’s celebration will feature a special guest appearance by NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell, a longtime supporter of Destination: College and a former football teammate of the late Jeff Cooney at Bronxville High School. Commissioner Goodell will participate in a live interview conducted by members of the 2025 Cooney Scholarship class, moderated by esteemed broadcaster and longtime DC volunteer Mary Civiello.

Kamora – Stony Brook

If you would like to attend Best Night of the Year please purchase your tickets as soon as possible to avoid disappointment.

Buy tickets HERE.

Get Involved

Whether you’re a student, educator, donor, or advocate, there’s a role for everyone in this mission. Click HERE to learn more, donate HERE , and discover how you can be part of building a brighter future—one student at a time.

The post Empowering Futures appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: A Destination: College Tradition!
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
After months of hard work Destination: College student athlete seniors are now making their commitments to colleges! The Cooney College Center is buzzing with excitement and anticipation for what’s next. Their journey through the Destination: College program over the past two years has been an ongoing commitment of their time and energy to all that…

The post A Destination: College Tradition! appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
After months of hard work Destination: College student athlete seniors are now making their commitments to colleges! The Cooney College Center is buzzing with excitement and anticipation for what’s next. Their journey through the Destination: College program over the past two years has been an ongoing commitment of their time and energy to all that we offer; Team Reads, mentoring, tutoring, attending The Cooney College Center and hours and hours of diligent hard work.

We have a time-honored tradition at DC to celebrate every time a student-athlete makes the commitment to their choice of college. How do we do that? We gift every senior with a sweatshirt from their college! College-branded merchandise holds a special place in the hearts of students, serving as a tangible representation of their pride and sense of belonging. 

The tradition of wearing college-branded sweatshirts is rooted in a blend of displaying school spirit, fostering a sense of community, and inclusivity.

At the Destination: College Cooney College Center this meaningful tradition marks the next chapter for our student-athletes and we couldn’t be prouder of them. Below are photos of our latest sweatshirt presentations!

Isaac – McCauley Honors College at John Jay CUNY Kimora – Stony Brook Jayden – Pace University Flavia – City College of New York Dylan – John Jay College Brian – Pace University Ellie – Rochester Institute of Technology Abraham – Mercy university Julieta – Binghapmton Kendarlin – Brockport Siena – Stony Brook Kamora – Stony Brook

Loan Counseling Session for Seniors

This past week we hosted a loan counseling session in the Cooney College Center for Destination: College seniors. Loan counseling provides crucial information and support in navigating what can be a complicated and confusing process.

Destination: College volunteers have vast experience and a deep understanding of this process. Their guidance and support of our student-athletes is invaluable.

Ms. Linda presenting to DC students DC volunteers working with a DC student-athlete Ms. Linda discusses the student loan process DC volunteer and student-athlete delving into student loan details Loan counseling A happy DC student-athlete!

The post A Destination: College Tradition! appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: This Week’s News
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
This past Monday was a big day for one group of Destination: College Juniors. They took part in our Spring 2025 College Trip! This year the group visited Siena College and University at Albany – State University of New York. Everyone met promptly for a 7.30am bus departure there was excitement for the day ahead.…

The post This Week’s News appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
This past Monday was a big day for one group of Destination: College Juniors. They took part in our Spring 2025 College Trip! This year the group visited Siena College and University at Albany – State University of New York.

Everyone met promptly for a 7.30am bus departure there was excitement for the day ahead. Accompanied by Ms. Michele, Ms. Laura and Ms. Linda, the students explored both campuses, participated in information sessions, viewed a dorm room, and attended campus walking tours.

It was also a great opportunity to meet up with several DC alumni who are students at either Siena or Albany. Our Juniors were eager to learn first hand from the DC alumni, who shared their experiences and answered questions.

The students also attended a Higher Educational Opportunity Program (HEOP) information session led by three DC alumni. This program has proven to be an important resource for students.

Everyone agreed that the day was extremely rewarding and a lot of fun – despite the early start!

Above, top row: The adventure begins, Siena dorm room visit, Ms. Laura, Ms. Linda and our students ready for the information session at Siena. Second row: taking in the facilities at Siena. 

Above, left to right: Our student pose at the bells which coincidental rang out to mark the event. The walking tour of Siena Campus continues.

Above: Students taking in the HEOP information session led by three DC alumni, Pariz, Aurora and Merrisa, who are enrolled in the HEOP program at Siena.

Above, top row, left to right: Ms. Linda and Ms. Laura with Kayla, a DC Alumni and freshman at Albany. Four members of the MVHS Knights football team, Darrelle, Bernard, Caiden and Jahni chat about the day. Four Volleyball players, Yuli, Mizzen, Madison, and Shea enjoy the day. DC alumni, G’yaah and Charlotte – now freshmen at Albany, share their experiences with the group.

Above, left to right: Three basketball players reunite. Zion, Gerald and BJ. Gerald is a DC Alum and a freshman at Albany. Zion and BJ are juniors considering Albany. Ms. Michele and Ms. Linda are very happy to see Charlotte and G’yaah, 2 DC Alumni and freshman at Albany. Janiel and Priscila enjoying the moment.

Finally, we found the perfect back drop for our juniors who have big dreams about the future. We are cheering them all on!

The post This Week’s News appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: College Acceptance Update!
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
Destination: College senior student athletes are evaluating their college acceptances and financial aid packages to determine which school is right for them. This week, we’d like to share a few heart-warming success stories from the seniors and their volunteer mentors. Ellie received 24 College Acceptances! Your read that right…Ellie has received a staggering 24 college…

The post College Acceptance Update! appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
Destination: College senior student athletes are evaluating their college acceptances and financial aid packages to determine which school is right for them. This week, we’d like to share a few heart-warming success stories from the seniors and their volunteer mentors.

Ellie received 24 College Acceptances!

Your read that right…Ellie has received a staggering 24 college acceptances! Ellie is a Denzel Washington School of the Arts student, a diligent Destination: College participant, Captain of the Mount Vernon High School Girls Swim team as well as Varsity Baseball Team Manager…and that is just the tip of the iceberg of Ellie’s extracurricular activities! We are so proud of you Ellie, and we’re excited to see where your journey takes you!

Kimora and Volunteer Ms. Lissa

Senior Kimora and volunteer Ms. Lissa are happy to celebrate Kimora’s many college acceptances. All of their hard work is paying off. Next steps…talking and deciding what will be the best option for Kimora. Good luck Kimora!

Tianna and Mentor Ms. Tracy

Tianna has received multiple acceptances from great colleges and now it’s time to discuss the details of each offer and decide on the perfect match. Decisions, decisions! With Ms. Tracy’s expert guidance we are sure Tianna will make the right choice for her college adventure. Good luck Tianna, and thank you Ms. Tracy for your dedication and great work!

Kamora, H.E.R Honoree

Kamora is a senior at Mount Vernon High School and an active member of Destination: College. Kamora was recently honored for her academics, leadership and community service at the H.E.R. (Helping Everyone Rise) event hosted by the City of Mount Vernon Youth Bureau Safe Place for Girls celebrating Women’s History Month. We are very proud of you, Kamora! Congratulations!

Kamora and Mentor Mr. Bob

Kamora and has worked with her mentor Mr. Bob throughout the college application process. They are now finished with the review process of Kamora’s college offers and it looks like Stony Brook University is a match! Kamora is an honor roll student, manager of the Mount Vernon Girls Varsity Basketball team, a volunteer for Ready4Life and Student Advocate for the City of Mount Vernon. Congratulations to this successful mentor/mentee partnership and thank you, Mr. Bob for your great work.

A Moment of Gratitude

We could not do what we do at Destination: College without our volunteers. Their dedication to our students goes above and beyond. We are grateful for their boundless energy and enthusiasm – their tireless support of our students and always going the extra mile with our students. Thank you!

Best Night of the Year 2025 Update

If you haven’t already, please save the date for our biggest fund raising event of the year! We will be celebrating the Best Night of the Year on June 11th, from 6pm – 8pm, at Siwanoy Country Club in Bronxville. Our very special guest will be NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell, who will be interviewed by our 2025 Cooney Scholars. Undoubtedly a “not-to-be-missed” exclusive!

Best Night of the Year is truly a special night for everyone involved with Destination: College and we are excited to welcome you all. Invitations will be sent very soon. Space is limited so please RSVP at your earliest convenience to avoid disappointment. Instructions for easy online registration will be enclosed with your invitation. If you do not receive an invitation and would like to attend please contact us at info@destinationcollegeny.org.

The post College Acceptance Update! appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: Latest News!
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
It’s a busy time of year at Destination: College. The focus is on scholarship applications, college acceptances, scholarship applications, and financial aid packages in order to make informed decisions on college selections. The Cooney College Center is buzzing on Tuesdays and Thursdays after classes finish as volunteers and students discuss options and process through the…

The post Latest News! appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
It’s a busy time of year at Destination: College. The focus is on scholarship applications, college acceptances, scholarship applications, and financial aid packages in order to make informed decisions on college selections. The Cooney College Center is buzzing on Tuesdays and Thursdays after classes finish as volunteers and students discuss options and process through the details.

March Madness Update

During our annual March Madness, we welcome Juniors to the Cooney College Center for the first time. This year the sessions have been very popular and well attended. Our second session was led by our Director of College Success and focused on essay writing. For many students March Madness is a first exposure to “what’s next” in the college application process. With one more March Madness session to go, we are excited to begin the journey with the promising young women and men.

Lohud Basketball Coaches Association Senior Game

Two long-time Destination: College student athletes were invited to play in the LHBC Association Senior Game this week. Congratulations to Kai Harvey and Tavien Tyler. We’re very proud of you!

Congratulations to Coach Cimino!

The Tom Konchalski Foundation recently held their Midtown Madness brunch at Bryant Park, NYC. The honorees included legendary NY Knick Walt “Clyde” Frazier and our very own Coach Bob Cimmino.
Dr. Pearce, Principal of Mount Vernon High School attended the event along with Nancy McKenna (Destination: College President and Board Chair) and Matt McKenna, as well as DC Board Member Rick Rugani, and volunteer James Reitano.
The work Coach Cimmino does with his team is unwavering and inspiring. He changes lives for the better. We were honored that Coach Cimmino made a gracious mention of Destination: College during his remarks, expressing his thanks for our help. Coach’s support for the work we do is heartwarming and reaffirming. Thank you, Coach and congratulations!

Screenshot

Team Reads Photo

DC Team Reads Volleyball and Swim teams got together with their volunteers for a photo op commemorating a great year and some very hard work! The energy is wonderful…great photo, everyone!

The post Latest News! appeared first on Destination College.

item.content:encoded:
Every March at Destination: College we hold March Madness over the course of three Thursdays. It’s an exciting time! For our Junior student athletes this marks their introduction to the world of post secondary education. It’s the first time they visit the Cooney College Center and led by our Director of College Access, the students get a preview of of the college application process.

This year’s March Madness kicked off on March 13th with an introduction to the “ins and outs” of college. The March 20th session will focus on essay writing, and the March 27th session will focus on financial aid. Stay tuned for more photos and updates!

March Madness at Destination: College is where our junior student athletes learn about the college application process 2025 March Madness comes to Destination: College. Juniors join us in the Cooney College Center for presentations It’s a lot of info to absorb, therefore we take 3 sessions over 3 weeks

The post March Madness appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: Alumni Reunion Party
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
It was wonderful to see thirty eight Destination: College alums at our Alumni Reunion Party on Tuesday, January 7th in the Mount Vernon High School Cafeteria. All were excited to connect with their mentors and check in, others were happy to see their friends and catch up. The energy in the room was upbeat and the…

The post Alumni Reunion Party appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
Destination: College alums and staff at the 2025 Alumni Reunion Party.

It was wonderful to see thirty eight Destination: College alums at our Alumni Reunion Party on Tuesday, January 7th in the Mount Vernon High School Cafeteria. All were excited to connect with their mentors and check in, others were happy to see their friends and catch up. The energy in the room was upbeat and the chatter was non-stop!

Things kicked off early with ten alums arriving at the Cooney College Center before the party started to work on their FAFSA applications with DC volunteers. It’s great that alums continue to access DC resources and look to us for guidance.

Eleven mentors attended the party, eager to check in with their mentees and hear how things are going. See below, Tyriek with mentor Bob Dennan, Ines with mentor Anne Angevine, mentor Phil Cannella and Rachel.

DC Mentors and Mentees at our Alumni Reunion Party 2025

We loved catching up with two juniors who will finish college early (pictured below with Laura Amigone, Director of College Success, who stands on the right) – Laila Issa (In the middle of the photo) who will finish her undergraduate studies this spring, and start med school in the fall at Sophie Davis Medical School at City College, and business major, Nico Zaffuto (left in the photo) who will graduate a semester early (Fall 2025) at the Honors Program at Iona College. 

DC continues to support and stay connect with ALL our graduates – including students who transition to the workforce. It was great to see Jayden and Demarley (photo below), who are working as assistant teachers in a special education classroom. 

Our students continue to stay in touch with each other, and their ongoing friendships keep DC strong as well – lots of hugs, and catching up!

Tribute to Linda D’Arcy

Laura Amigone, our Director of College Success, led a heartfelt and well-deserved tribute to DC former staff member and now volunteer, Ms. Linda. Ms. Laura spoke of her own enduring relationship with Ms. Linda, how Ms. Linda brought her into the DC world and how much Ms. Linda had taught her when she first came to Destination: College. Ms. Michele, our Executive Director (not pictured), went on to discuss Ms. Linda’s many years as Director of College Access and Ms. Linda’s kind and caring approach which endures as she continues to work with Destination: College as a volunteer in our Cooney College Center. Ms. Laura then invited students to say a few words about their experiences with Ms. Linda.

Kaseem Miller (below, second from left) offered Ms. Linda his heartfelt thanks to his mentor for always being there for him since he was 16! (Kaseem is now 26) Kaseem described Ms. Linda as “Someone to call to talk through things”, helping him get his internship at Pepsi, which he has since turned into a full time job. 

Thank you to all who attended. We think you’ll agree that the 2025 Alumni Reunion Party was a wonderful success! Scroll below to see more photos.

Here’s what some of the alums had to say: 

“Love my campus, and can’t wait to go back!”
Stephany (SUNY Oswego) , Aurora, Pariz, and Merissa (all at Siena College)

“I did well, and I know I can do even better next semester.”
Melinda at Pace

“I’m so glad I’m at Cortland in the EOP program, they are so great – first place I go when I have a question about anything”
Tyriek at SUNY Cortland. 

“I can’t tell you how grateful I am to DC!”
Tyra Williams, Junior at Howard University – planning to take the LSAT exam this summer and apply for law school in the fall.

The post Alumni Reunion Party appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: College Knowledge Session is a Success with a Visit from DC Alumni
item.dc:creator: Nicki Piercy
item.description:
In May, we conducted four College Knowledge sessions for our 2023 graduates. The sessions were led by Linda D’Arcy, Director of College Access, and Laura Amignone, Director of College Success. A few of our many impressive alumni returned to share their personal experiences about succeeding in college. Our alumni chatted for over an hour and…

The post College Knowledge Session is a Success with a Visit from DC Alumni appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
In May, we conducted four College Knowledge sessions for our 2023 graduates. The sessions were led by Linda D’Arcy, Director of College Access, and Laura Amignone, Director of College Success. A few of our many impressive alumni returned to share their personal experiences about succeeding in college. Our alumni chatted for over an hour and provided invaluable advise for our seniors and much gratitude to DC for our support and guidance.

Taylor Bennet:

DC provided me with so much. I remember when I first sought out DC, I didn’t know what I was walking into, but this is a family, helping me with financial aid to pay for school, helping me get stuff for my dorm room. Ms. Linda and Ms. Laura help you stay updated on everything …

Paige Loague:

DC sends constant reminders. These are things that aren’t right in your face, your peers don’t get these reminders, but you are getting the reminder to go do it. Book stipends, they’re there for those expensive books. DC really helps, They are genuine good people who want to see you win. Especially if you go away, you may feel on your own, but they are here with you every step of the way, and then one day you’ll be up here giving advice.

Leni Marilejos:

DC is a great support system. DC supported me so much throughout my application process, not just with the FAFSA, but actually pushing me to do it – even schools that you were scared to apply to, and help you- even the mentors, they check in with you monthly. I really enjoy having my mentor ask me how I’m doing and talk with them. 

Final sum up:

What you wish you knew?

  1. “Going to be ok!” If anxious about going to new school, new environment, it will be daunting, but it will ok – everyone will be as new as you are. 
  2. “College is going to be hard, but don’t let it break you”
  3. “Don’t be afraid to be you; Go on that campus on be your greatest self”

The post College Knowledge Session is a Success with a Visit from DC Alumni appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: March Madness Dreams Come True!
item.dc:creator: fern
item.description:
One year ago our Destination: College community was celebrating the Mount Vernon Knights on their NYS Section 1 Basketball Championship win. Fast forward to 2023 and March Madness took on a new level of celebration for DC! Jeff Cooney Memorial Scholar ’18, Demetre Roberts, had a starring role with the Fairleigh Dickinson Knights in a…

The post March Madness Dreams Come True! appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
One year ago our Destination: College community was celebrating the Mount Vernon Knights on their NYS Section 1 Basketball Championship win.

Fast forward to 2023 and March Madness took on a new level of celebration for DC! Jeff Cooney Memorial Scholar ’18, Demetre Roberts, had a starring role with the Fairleigh Dickinson Knights in a historic upset of #1 seed Purdue University in the first round of the NCAA tournament. While FDU did not move past the second round against Florida Atlantic, Demetre’s exceptional skills were on full display as the top scorer for FDU in that game. What a story!

Demetre joined Destination: College in the summer of 7th grade and worked closely with our dedicated volunteers throughout high school to excel academically and meet the eligibility requirements for collegiate recruitment. We are so proud to have been part of his team and for all that he has accomplished.

This short video sharing the arc of his journey from high school, to Division 2 basketball powerhouse Saint Thomas Aquinas, to FDU to earn a graduate degree, to the NCAA tournament, is worth the watch! Click here!

The post March Madness Dreams Come True! appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: Meet our New Executive Director, Michele Roque
item.dc:creator: fern
item.description:
As announced to the Destination: College community Suzanne McCann, our Executive Director who served DC with tremendous commitment and skill since 2014, has decided to step down at the end of this school year. After an extensive search, the Board of Destination: College is thrilled to announce their unanimous selection of Michele Roque to fill…

The post Meet our New Executive Director, Michele Roque appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
As announced to the Destination: College community Suzanne McCann, our Executive Director who served DC with tremendous commitment and skill since 2014, has decided to step down at the end of this school year. After an extensive search, the Board of Destination: College is thrilled to announce their unanimous selection of Michele Roque to fill the position of Executive Director, effective July 1. 

Michele comes to Destination: College with an abiding commitment to its mission to make college a reality for our students. Michele has a deep understanding of DC having been the Program Head for Girls Basketball for three years. This past year, Michele volunteered her time and talents to our Cooney College Center. Michele is a proud graduate of Mount Vernon High School, has a BA from SUNY Binghamton and a Master of Arts in Literature from Mercy College, where she is an adjunct professor of English. She resides in Pelham, NY and her civic involvement is extensive. She is a past president of the Pelham Education Foundation, the Pelham PTA Council, and the Pelham School Board Citizens Nominating Committee, among other activities. Michele also has considerable experience as an executive in the retail industry, working at Polo Jeans and Armani Exchange. We are thrilled to officially welcome Michele to our DC family and to start our next chapter under her capable hands. 

Although Michele will officially take her position on July 1, you will be seeing her in the hallways of MVHS for the next few months as she begins to learn the ropes from Suzanne. Please feel free to introduce yourselves and welcome Michele to our community! We will be honoring Suzanne for her many contributions to Destination: College at our June 14 dinner at the Bronxville Field Club. We hope you will join us to toast Suzanne for all that she has accomplished.

The post Meet our New Executive Director, Michele Roque appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: Lady Knights Meet with Cheryl Davis
item.dc:creator: fern
item.description:
Lawyer, screenwriter, playwright, author, and Mount Vernon High School alum Cheryl Davis joined the MV Lady Knights Volleyball team to speak about her path to college at Princeton and a dual Masters in Law and Journalism at Columbia University. Degrees that have led to her current role as general counsel for the Author’s Guild in NYC as well…

The post Lady Knights Meet with Cheryl Davis appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
Lawyer, screenwriter, playwright, author, and Mount Vernon High School alum Cheryl Davis joined the MV Lady Knights Volleyball team to speak about her path to college at Princeton and a dual Masters in Law and Journalism at Columbia University. Degrees that have led to her current role as general counsel for the Author’s Guild in NYC as well as vast work in theater and television writing. Our student-athletes asked many questions and were inspired to by a variety of career ideas. Thank you Cheryl! 

The post Lady Knights Meet with Cheryl Davis appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: Recent College Acceptances
item.dc:creator: fern
item.description:
We have a great tradition in our Cooney College Center – every time a senior receives an acceptance, we ring a bell. The bell has been ringing often as the acceptances are rolling in for our seniors!  The students have been hard at work on applications, completing financial aid forms, applying for scholarships and it’s really paying off. There’s…

The post Recent College Acceptances appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
We have a great tradition in our Cooney College Center – every time a senior receives an acceptance, we ring a bell. The bell has been ringing often as the acceptances are rolling in for our seniors! 

The students have been hard at work on applications, completing financial aid forms, applying for scholarships and it’s really paying off. There’s no greater joy for all of us than seeing those emails that say, “CONGRATULATIONS, YOU’RE IN!”

University of Pennsylvania
Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute
Manhattan College Siena College
lona College
Pace University
SUNY Albany
Binghamton University
Stony Brook University
Purchase College

Mount Saint Vincent College
Manhattanville College
Mercy College Benedict College
Hofstra University
Morgan State University
City College of New York
Hunter College
Lehman College
Baruch College

The post Recent College Acceptances appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: DC Alumni Reunion 2023
item.dc:creator: fern
item.description:
On January 5, 2023 Destination: College welcomed our college students back to Mount Vernon High School for our first college break DC Alumni Reunion since 2020. It was fun to trade tales of campus experiences with College Success mentors, friends, and teammates. MVHS Principal, Dr. Pauline Pearce, kicked off the celebration thanking DC for “making…

The post DC Alumni Reunion 2023 appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
On January 5, 2023 Destination: College welcomed our college students back to Mount Vernon High School for our first college break DC Alumni Reunion since 2020. It was fun to trade tales of campus experiences with College Success mentors, friends, and teammates. MVHS Principal, Dr. Pauline Pearce, kicked off the celebration thanking DC for “making a big difference.”

It’s going to be great spring semester for 130+ DC students who attend over 70 colleges and universities.

The post DC Alumni Reunion 2023 appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: DC Student Athletes visit Siena College and University at Albany
item.dc:creator: fern
item.description:
20+ Destination: College senior Student Athletes from Mount Vernon CSD NY visited Siena College and University at Albany on November 11th.For many, it was the first time on a college tour. The opportunity to visit a campus with a group of classmates and friends at this scale is a game-changer. It was rewarding to hear how many students planned…

The post DC Student Athletes visit Siena College and University at Albany appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
20+ Destination: College senior Student Athletes from Mount Vernon CSD NY visited Siena College and University at Albany on November 11th.For many, it was the first time on a college tour. The opportunity to visit a campus with a group of classmates and friends at this scale is a game-changer. It was rewarding to hear how many students planned to add Siena College, University at Albany, or both to their Common Application.Mobilizing a group this large takes a lot of effort and is truly worth the commitment.

The post DC Student Athletes visit Siena College and University at Albany appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: Heily Gonzales, Cooney Scholar ’22, selected for Cornell Black Ivy Pre-Law Society
item.dc:creator: neonadmin
item.description:
Congratulations to Destination: College Cooney Scholar ’22/ Mount Vernon Steam Academy ’22 alum Heily Gonzales on her selection to the prestigious Black Ivy Pre-Law Society at Cornell University. The Society provides opportunities to expose members to top law schools, firms, and the legal field. Each year the Society plans an #Advantagetour. This year they are HARD…

The post Heily Gonzales, Cooney Scholar ’22, selected for Cornell Black Ivy Pre-Law Society appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
Congratulations to Destination: College Cooney Scholar ’22/ Mount Vernon Steam Academy ’22 alum Heily Gonzales on her selection to the prestigious Black Ivy Pre-Law Society at Cornell University. 
The Society provides opportunities to expose members to top law schools, firms, and the legal field. Each year the Society plans an #Advantagetour. This year they are HARD AT WORK fundraising for a Washington D.C. trip to visit the Supreme Court, the Library of Congress, the African American History Museum, and multiple prestigious law schools. Get packing! We know Heily will help you get there! 

The post Heily Gonzales, Cooney Scholar ’22, selected for Cornell Black Ivy Pre-Law Society appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: DC Student Athletes Visit Regneron
item.dc:creator: neonadmin
item.description:

The Regeneron team spoke about their college and career paths, creating opportunities, and took time to learn about each student’s goals. We LOVED seeing the labs and learning about the expansive of scope of innovation, funding, and logistics to get…

The post DC Student Athletes Visit Regneron appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
Destination: College/Mount Vernon CSD Student-Athletes enjoyed an INFORMATIVE and spirited afternoon at the Regeneron campus. The Regeneron team spoke about their college and career paths, creating opportunities, and took time to learn about each student’s goals. We LOVED seeing the labs and learning about the expansive of scope of innovation, funding, and logistics to get a drug to market. A special thank you to Volunteer NY! for coordinating our 3rd Annual workshop with Regeneron and Destination: College.

The post DC Student Athletes Visit Regneron appeared first on Destination College.

item.title: Volunteer Kick-Off Coffee
item.dc:creator: neonadmin
item.description:
Our Executive Director, Suzanne McCann and Chair, Nancy McKenna hosted a group of new and returning volunteers at our annual Volunteer Kick Off Coffee on Thursday, September 15, 2022 at the beautiful Bronxville Field Club. The event was well attended and gave everyone an opportunity to prepare for the upcoming school year. McCann reviewed planned…

The post Volunteer Kick-Off Coffee appeared first on Destination College.
item.content:encoded:
Our Executive Director, Suzanne McCann and Chair, Nancy McKenna hosted a group of new and returning volunteers at our annual Volunteer Kick Off Coffee on Thursday, September 15, 2022 at the beautiful Bronxville Field Club. The event was well attended and gave everyone an opportunity to prepare for the upcoming school year. McCann reviewed planned programs as well as policies and procedures. Everyone enjoyed the opportunity to come together again and is excited for the new school year.

The post Volunteer Kick-Off Coffee appeared first on Destination College.
